flashcards.meaning: The great Vedantic statement - You are That
The great Vedantic statement from Mandukya Upanishad

grammar.title: Vedic Sanskrit
grammar.meaning: The language of the Vedas with unique features
grammar.usage: Vedic Sanskrit differs from Classical Sanskrit in accent, morphology, and syntax
grammar.notes: Vedic Sanskrit preserves many archaic features

practice.question: Which Upanishad contains the Mahavakya 'तत्त्वमसि'?
practice.explanation: The great statement 'तत्त्वमसि' appears in the Chandogya Upanishad

reading.title: From Bhagavad Gita
reading.sanskrit: कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन। मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि।
reading.romanization: karmaṇyevādhikāraste mā phaleṣu kadācana. mā karmaphalaheturbhūrmā te saṅgo'stvakarmaṇi.
reading.english: You have a right to perform your prescribed duty, but you are not entitled to the fruits of action. Never consider yourself the cause of the results of your activities, and never be attached to not doing your duty.
